description: Query inventory information. This includes managed node status, such as Stopped or Terminated.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: One or more filters. Use a filter to return a more specific list of results. (dict) --- One or more filters. The name of the filter key. Inventory filter values. Example: inventory filter where managed node IDs are specified as values Key=AWS:InstanceInformation.InstanceId,Values= i-a12b3c4d5e6g, i-1a2b3c4d5e6,Type=Equal. (string) --- Type (string) --- The type of filter.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The name of the filter key.

nested_params.name: Values
nested_params.description: Inventory filter values. Example: inventory filter where managed node IDs are specified as values Key=AWS:InstanceInformation.InstanceId,Values= i-a12b3c4d5e6g, i-1a2b3c4d5e6,Type=Equal.

parameters.name: Aggregators
parameters.description: Returns counts of inventory types based on one or more expressions. For example, if you aggregate by using an expression that uses the AWS:InstanceInformation.PlatformType type, you can see a count of how many Windows and Linux managed nodes exist in your inventoried fleet. (dict) --- Specifies the inventory type and attribute for the aggregation execution. Expression (string) --- The inventory type and attribute name for aggregation. Aggregators (list) --- Nested aggregators to further refine aggregation for an inventory type. Groups (list) --- A user-defined set of one or more filters on which to aggregate inventory data. Groups return a count of resources that match and don't match the specified criteria. (dict) --- A user-defined set of one or more filters on which to aggregate inventory data. The name of the group. Filters define the criteria for the group. The matchingCount field displays the number of resources that match the criteria. The notMatchingCount field displays the number of resources that don't match the criteria. (dict) --- One or more filters. Use a filter to return a more specific list of results. The name of the filter key. Inventory filter values. Example: inventory filter where managed node IDs are specified as values Key=AWS:InstanceInformation.InstanceId,Values= i-a12b3c4d5e6g, i-1a2b3c4d5e6,Type=Equal. (string) --- Type (string) --- The type of filter.

nested_params.name: Expression
nested_params.description: The inventory type and attribute name for aggregation.

nested_params.name: Aggregators
nested_params.description: Nested aggregators to further refine aggregation for an inventory type.

nested_params.name: Groups
nested_params.description: A user-defined set of one or more filters on which to aggregate inventory data. Groups return a count of resources that match and don't match the specified criteria.

nested_params.name: Filters
nested_params.description: Filters define the criteria for the group. The matchingCount field displays the number of resources that match the criteria. The notMatchingCount field displays the number of resources that don't match the criteria.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The name of the filter key.

nested_params.name: Values
nested_params.description: Inventory filter values. Example: inventory filter where managed node IDs are specified as values Key=AWS:InstanceInformation.InstanceId,Values= i-a12b3c4d5e6g, i-1a2b3c4d5e6,Type=Equal.

parameters.name: ResultAttributes
parameters.description: The list of inventory item types to return. (dict) --- The inventory item result attribute. Name of the inventory item type. Valid value: AWS:InstanceInformation. Default Value: AWS:InstanceInformation.

nested_params.name: TypeName
nested_params.description: Name of the inventory item type. Valid value: AWS:InstanceInformation. Default Value: AWS:InstanceInformation.

nested_items.name: Entities
nested_items.description: Collection of inventory entities such as a collection of managed node inventory.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: ID of the inventory result entity. For example, for managed node inventory the result will be the managed node ID. For EC2 instance inventory, the result will be the instance ID.

nested_items.name: TypeName
nested_items.description: The name of the inventory result item type.

nested_items.name: SchemaVersion
nested_items.description: The schema version for the inventory result item/

nested_items.name: CaptureTime
nested_items.description: The time inventory item data was captured.

nested_items.name: ContentHash
nested_items.description: MD5 hash of the inventory item type contents. The content hash is used to determine whether to update inventory information. The PutInventory API doesn't update the inventory item type contents if the MD5 hash hasn't changed since last update.

nested_items.name: Content
nested_items.description: Contains all the inventory data of the item type. Results include attribute names and values.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to use when requesting the next set of items. If there are no additional items to return, the string is empty.
